nodes.comment: My family cannot mask. We shop in broken arrow because we aren't mistreated there. The more mandates there are, the more innocent people like us are discriminated against out of fear.
nodes.author: Melissa Nunamaker
nodes.extracted: My family cannot mask.

nodes.comment: I have family that goes to that school and it should ALWAYS be the parents choice
nodes.author: Scott Smith
nodes.extracted: I have family that goes to that school and it should ALWAYS be the parents choice

nodes.comment: Give parents the CHOICE, if you want your child to wear a mask to school, great! If you feel your child and family doesn’t need the mask, awesome! We the parents can make those choices for our children!
nodes.author: Taryn Deenik
nodes.extracted: If you feel your child and family doesn’t need the mask, awesome!

nodes.comment: I’m signing because I’m hoping for this to be in effect for ALL California schools. If not, I know we as a family, will be strongly considering not only pulling our kids out of the school system, but also pulling our tax dollars out of the state completely. This state is toxic to literally everyone except the politicians. Enough is enough.
nodes.author: Stephanie Schodensack
nodes.extracted: If not, I know we as a family, will be strongly considering not only pulling our kids out of the school system, but also pulling our tax dollars out of the state completely.

nodes.comment: I believe that masks should be voluntary not mandatory. Let each family decide.
nodes.author: Erin Schumacher
nodes.extracted: Let each family decide.

nodes.comment: Reinforce healthy life style behaviors, proper eating and exercise in conjunction with vaccination for those who choose to  get it.  At this stage, masks serve no purpose and this should be a family choice!
nodes.author: Mike Georgiou
nodes.extracted: At this stage, masks serve no purpose and this should be a family choice!

nodes.comment: I think it should be a choice for each family to decide for their children to mask or not
nodes.author: Heather Granc
nodes.extracted: I think it should be a choice for each family to decide for their children to mask or not

nodes.comment: Absolutely believe it a family's right to choose. This is a vaccination not an immunization.
nodes.author: tracy bencal
nodes.extracted: Absolutely believe it a family's right to choose.

nodes.comment: Last time I checked, my child's health was my problem. The government and school districts should focus their attention on doing the most possible to ensure a clean environment, including, but not limited to better air filtration in each class and in the main system overall and proper sanitizing. The choice of masks or this particular shot should be my family's decision alone.
nodes.author: Carol Allain
nodes.extracted: The choice of masks or this particular shot should be my family's decision alone.

nodes.comment: I agree with this and know we must speak out to prevent further damage to our kids. I stand up for my right to make decisions for my family. I support the idea that families make their own choices.
nodes.author: John Ryan Duffey
nodes.extracted: I stand up for my right to make decisions for my family.

nodes.comment: I have my freedoms to choose what is best for my health and my family's health.
nodes.author: Tayna Holmstead
nodes.extracted: I have my freedoms to choose what is best for my health and my family's health.

nodes.comment: It should be a choice each teacher and family gets to make for themselves.
nodes.author: Shannon Pyers
nodes.extracted: It should be a choice each teacher and family gets to make for themselves.

nodes.comment: I support my friends and family. We have a right to make our own health decisions for ourselves and our children. This mask issue is a matter of personal preference.
nodes.author: Sarah Zacour
nodes.extracted: I support my friends and family.

nodes.comment: I have family who are still in school and some who have  breathing problems... Mask should be optional or not at all
nodes.author: Erin Owen
nodes.extracted: I have family who are still in school and some who have  breathing problems...

nodes.comment: My family is done with this nonsense.
nodes.author: Heather Radford
nodes.extracted: My family is done with this nonsense.

nodes.comment:
I am over Cooper and these schoolboards making health decisions for children that are not theirs. We are the parents and if we do not want our children in masks for health and mental reasons. The parents that want their children in masks can wear masks. 
It's pretty darn simple.
This is POLITICAL not about a virus.
My local school board here in Cherokee County actually blocked me after I posted a very similar opinion on their website and I was promoting homeschooling because of this nonsense. No sooner did I post it boom the whole post was gone in thin air.
This has nothing to do with a virus just a bunch of dictators wanting to control everybody. 
They absolutely will NOT control me and my family.
nodes.author: Jane Wiacek
nodes.extracted: They absolutely will NOT control me and my family.

nodes.comment: Each family should make their own choice!
nodes.author: Emily Jasinskis
nodes.extracted: Each family should make their own choice!

nodes.comment: Masks are harmful and unnecessary! Kids are not the issue, it’s been proven! Stop the control! Do not make our children wear masks! Family choice!!!!
nodes.author: Rebekka Spanier
nodes.extracted: Family choice!!!

nodes.comment: Kids need to breath. Give each family the choice. Lack of oxygen and too much carbon dioxide is dangerous for kids. Also breathing in bacteria from dirty masks is also dangerous for kids.
nodes.author: Ariane Rosas
nodes.extracted: Give each family the choice.

nodes.comment: Masks should be a family choice!
nodes.author: Angie Tschida
nodes.extracted: Masks should be a family choice!

nodes.comment: I should make the choice for my family and my children on whether to wear a mask as this is a medical device.
nodes.author: andrea forget-Schnowske
nodes.extracted: I should make the choice for my family and my children on whether to wear a mask as this is a medical device.

nodes.comment: Parental choice gives everyone the right to choose what is best for their family!
nodes.author: Kristin Wagner
nodes.extracted: Parental choice gives everyone the right to choose what is best for their family!

nodes.comment: Our children deserve the same freedoms we enjoyed growing up, seeing their friends, family, teachers, etc faces and expressions. Don’t keep hiding our kids faces for health reasons, safety reasons and for their confidence and dignity, keep the masks OFF THE KIDS!!
nodes.author: Christi Little
nodes.extracted: Our children deserve the same freedoms we enjoyed growing up, seeing their friends, family, teachers, etc faces and expressions.

nodes.comment: It should be a family choice with our Doctors not a Elected official who does not have any medical info on our children
nodes.author: Shannon Saunders
nodes.extracted: It should be a family choice with our Doctors not a Elected official who does not have any medical info on our children

nodes.comment: It is not ok to force children to mask. Mental health is on the rise in our children and mandating masks will hurt the children more. If the family decides the child has to mask that's fine but if the family decides against the masks. That should be honored in the Schools also.
nodes.author: Barbara Poznak
nodes.extracted: If the family decides the child has to mask that's fine but if the family decides against the masks.

nodes.comment: The masking of a child should be decided by the parents of that child, as each family has its own unique health situation.  All benefits of masking (arguably none to minimal) must outweigh the negative long term effects of 7 hour masking.  This is a parents choice.  Not a broad brush one size fits all.  Definitely should not be mandatory.
nodes.author: Erica Mayor
nodes.extracted: The masking of a child should be decided by the parents of that child, as each family has its own unique health situation.

nodes.comment: Masks should be optional and classes in person! My family paid for an in person experience, not an  on line one. Please stop with the insanity !
nodes.author: Valerie Hogan
nodes.extracted: My family paid for an in person experience, not an  on line one.

nodes.comment: Its time to stand up.. yes we understand there is a sickness and some can not fight it due compromised immune systems. But this is a good reason why it should be our decisions on what to do for our children. My family chooses to trust in our Faith in God and what he has planed for us. We have traveled so much over the summer and through all of this chaos and I feel God has kept us safe. This is not fair to push something on these staff members and children that many do NOT want a part of. Our rights have been violated in so many ways during this chaos and its time for a stand.
nodes.author: Sheri Stevenson
nodes.extracted: My family chooses to trust in our Faith in God and what he has planed for us.

nodes.comment: My family will not live in fear. We will not comply with any mandates
nodes.author: Pete Williams
nodes.extracted: My family will not live in fear.

nodes.comment: I’m signing this petition because I have had enough of being told what’s best for my family. Our decision! Masks don’t work IMO but if it gives you a sense of security wear it at will not by force
nodes.author: Daniel Cantu
nodes.extracted: I’m signing this petition because I have had enough of being told what’s best for my family.

nodes.comment: This polarizing topic can not even be agreed upon between the medical professionals and therefore schools should NOT be making this decision for students or parents.  Only one decision here does not force anyone to do anything against their beliefs...which is to leave it up to the parents to make this decision. Any other decision forces one side to do what they believe is wrong and more dangerous for their family.  Leaving this to the parents does not force those who want to wear masks to not wear them. They can still wear them and have that protection.  It should not be forced on those that do not agree.
nodes.author: Lindsay Ali
nodes.extracted: Any other decision forces one side to do what they believe is wrong and more dangerous for their family.

nodes.comment: My granddaughter and family friends' children attend Monroe County Schools.
nodes.author: Kimberly Watts
nodes.extracted: My granddaughter and family friends' children attend Monroe County Schools.

nodes.comment: This should be a family decision. My family. My health. My choice
nodes.author: Alicia Vilics
nodes.extracted: This should be a family decision. [...] My family.

nodes.comment:
Cases in Geauga County are at the same level as when the Gov said we could stop
wearing masks.    As a parent I should get to decide when my child wears a mask.    I chose to vaccinate my children for their safety.    If cases were to increase, we would decide as a family if we should wear masks.   I am not against masks.   I do not want to be mandated to wear one or have my children told they must.
nodes.author: Andrea Ryan
nodes.extracted: If cases were to increase, we would decide as a family if we should wear masks.

nodes.comment: It’s MY right to make my own decision for my family!  I’m not mad if you wear a mask- But we both should have the freedom to do what is best for us.
nodes.author: Laura Cusick
nodes.extracted: It’s MY right to make my own decision for my family!

nodes.comment: This is America and I’m standing for the freedom to choose what is best for my family and myself. ✝️♥️
nodes.author: Cynthia Tancredi
nodes.extracted: This is America and I’m standing for the freedom to choose what is best for my family and myself.

nodes.comment: Every family has the Constitutional and God-given right to decide what is best for them
nodes.author: Lynda Bourland
nodes.extracted: Every family has the Constitutional and God-given right to decide what is best for them

nodes.comment: The decision to wear masks should be left to the family and NOT MANDATED!!! Masking apparently did not work the first time because we knew it was a useless mandate. So why would you mandate it again.  This is a personal right and a freedom to choose. Let those who want wear masks. That is their right and freedom. Allow the rest of us to exercise ours. Thank you.
nodes.author: Tammy Taylor
nodes.extracted: The decision to wear masks should be left to the family and NOT MANDATED!!!

nodes.comment: No one has authority over our bodies other than our Creator in Heaven. We live in this great country because of FREEDOM. No human man has the right to mandate us or our children to wear a mask. The Bible says over and over to "Fear not". My God is bigger then any disease on this planet. I believe being told to wear a mask is to live in fear. I, and my family, will obey our Lord and Savoir Jesus Christ and "Fear not".
nodes.author: Jeremy Chris
nodes.extracted: I, and my family, will obey our Lord and Savoir Jesus Christ and "Fear not".

nodes.comment: I'm signing this beacuase it should be every family right to choose to mask  up or not
nodes.author: Jessica Spurr
nodes.extracted: I'm signing this beacuase it should be every family right to choose to mask  up or not

nodes.comment: I should have the right to make medical decisions for my child and family, and my child should not have to live in fear for something that is 99.9% survivable. My son has a sensory processing disorder and this should be taken into account instead of forcing him to wear a mask all day, we are not taking kids emotional well being into consideration
nodes.author: Kaci Sielsky
nodes.extracted: I should have the right to make medical decisions for my child and family, and my child should not have to live in fear for something that is 99.9% survivable.

nodes.comment: I want to be able to choose for my own family, not be forced.
nodes.author: Laura Paas
nodes.extracted: I want to be able to choose for my own family, not be forced.

nodes.comment: Dr. Comstock and her selective science is for her own person gain, it is not for the wellness of children and families.  Family choice! No mandates! No threats!
nodes.author: Denise Parker
nodes.extracted: Family choice!

nodes.comment: I’m for freedom to choose what’s best for myself and my family
nodes.author: Nathanal Brady
nodes.extracted: I’m for freedom to choose what’s best for myself and my family

nodes.comment: Masks should be optional for each family. None of this K-8 business.
nodes.author: Amber Eggers
nodes.extracted: Masks should be optional for each family.

nodes.comment: If not now, when will parents be able to once again choose what is best for their family and their child? This blanketed masking approach must stop.  We are responsible enough to make these decisions for ourselves.  After masks, what's next?
nodes.author: Ashley Willis
nodes.extracted: If not now, when will parents be able to once again choose what is best for their family and their child?

nodes.comment: I believe each family has the right to choose if they want to wear a mask or not. I do not believe the mask affects transmission per particle size and they are constantly touching the mask and then touching other things! I do not believe it is healthy for any of us to wear a mask for several hours a day.
nodes.author: Laura Hall
nodes.extracted: I believe each family has the right to choose if they want to wear a mask or not.

nodes.comment:
My children are MY children.  And their medical decisions are mine to make. Dawn Comstock is not my family doctor. Her overreach in JeffCo Public Schools is insane. 
She is not looking out for the best interest of our community and her wrath needs to end.
nodes.author: Natassia Anderson
nodes.extracted: Dawn Comstock is not my family doctor.

nodes.comment:
Enough is enough already, mandatory masking violates many laws and human rights, at worst it should be the parents choice in deciding what their child wears over their face.

If the teachers wont do their job, they need to look for a new profession at this point. 

Let the fearful sheep or those with family medical issues continue online, you have plenty of federal and state grants to allow this, our kids are not your social experiment.

The masking experiment is a failure, stop doubling down on stupidity.
nodes.author: Levi mayer
nodes.extracted: Let the fearful sheep or those with family medical issues continue online, you have plenty of federal and state grants to allow this, our kids are not your social experiment.

nodes.comment: Parents should have the right to choose whats best for their family! The children have suffered enough.
nodes.author: Samantha Stroh
nodes.extracted: Parents should have the right to choose whats best for their family!

nodes.comment: I advocate  for the right of my patients, myself, my family, and all individuals' autonomy  of medical decisions in all aspects of their care.
nodes.author: Tamara Borella
nodes.extracted: I advocate  for the right of my patients, myself, my family, and all individuals' autonomy  of medical decisions in all aspects of their care.

nodes.comment: Masks optional!!!! You get a choice for your family and I get a choice for my family.
nodes.author: Courtney Gradert
nodes.extracted: You get a choice for your family and I get a choice for my family.

nodes.comment: I'm singing because I believe in family rights and medical freedom
nodes.author: Michael Oconnor
nodes.extracted: I'm singing because I believe in family rights and medical freedom

nodes.comment: I believe in America we have free choice for our children..and we above all know what is best for out family
nodes.author: holly sedlacek
nodes.extracted: I believe in America we have free choice for our children..and we above all know what is best for out family

nodes.comment: I'm signing this due to the fact that I have the right to say what risks my child and my family are willing to take in everyday life not a school board. Saying school busses are public transportation in order to keep masks on our children is unbelievable. Public transportation is transportation for the public. No random citizen from any public setting can just get on a school bus. Not only that our kids all play together at the parks, in stores and everywhere else throughout our daily lives wothout masks at our own risk....NOT YOURS! All anyone is asking for is that our risk is our concern. Your teachers are vaccinated and safe. Anyone who wants to wear a mask should be allowed the same as anyone who doesn't. Covering children's faces is mentally damaging and needs to stop!
nodes.author: Peter Alvarez
nodes.extracted: I'm signing this due to the fact that I have the right to say what risks my child and my family are willing to take in everyday life not a school board.

nodes.comment: At this point it totally should remain a choice for each person and family!
nodes.author: Laura Kahle
nodes.extracted: At this point it totally should remain a choice for each person and family!

nodes.comment: Each family should have a choice to choose what is best for their children. One size doesn’t fit all.
nodes.author: jennifer clarkson
nodes.extracted: Each family should have a choice to choose what is best for their children.

nodes.comment: I believe in medical freedom. I am against mandatory masking of all students. Let each individual family decide what is best for themselves.
nodes.author: jamie vanness
nodes.extracted: Let each individual family decide what is best for themselves.

nodes.comment: I belief there is no proof that the cloth mask work. Every family should have a choice to mask or not mask. My grandson is entering K. How can children this young learn with there teachers face covered. Also when I picked him up from PreK last year. His mask was soaked with his saliva. How is this healthy. He also has asthma. Thank you
nodes.author: Terry Morris
nodes.extracted: Every family should have a choice to mask or not mask.

nodes.comment: This should be a family choice. Children need to be able to learn in a normal environment.
nodes.author: Mike Melton
nodes.extracted: This should be a family choice.

nodes.comment: There is more research showing masks are not as effective as people think. Masks do more harm than good. We do not wear masks in my family and are against them. We should have the deciding factor for our own children
nodes.author: Jesica Lamparter
nodes.extracted: We do not wear masks in my family and are against them.

nodes.comment: Parents - not politicians - should be the ones to assess the risks for their family and decide how best to protect the physical, emotional, developmental and academic well-being of their children.
nodes.author: Kathleen Boll
nodes.extracted: Parents - not politicians - should be the ones to assess the risks for their family and decide how best to protect the physical, emotional, developmental and academic well-being of their children.

nodes.comment: I was finally warming up to getting the vax for my HS freshman (my wife and I are both vaccinated) and jeffco SD issued mandatory weekly testing for HS athletes and staff... at the insistance of Dr Comstock. Huge over reach. Get out of my family's personal decisions.
nodes.author: Emilio Ramirez
nodes.extracted: Get out of my family's personal decisions.

nodes.comment: I believe in family choice!
nodes.author: Shannon Oslund
nodes.extracted: I believe in family choice!

nodes.comment: This should be our choice, for our family.
nodes.author: Jason Barron
nodes.extracted: This should be our choice, for our family.

nodes.comment: No masks for kids. Individual family choice!
nodes.author: Jennifer Murphy
nodes.extracted: Individual family choice!

nodes.comment: We should choose what is best for our children and family!!
nodes.author: tanya Murphy
nodes.extracted: We should choose what is best for our children and family!

nodes.comment: School boards making medical decisions for me and my family is not appreciated or accepted.  Parents should have choice about all medical decisions for their children.
nodes.author: Sheree Wilkinson
nodes.extracted: School boards making medical decisions for me and my family is not appreciated or accepted.

nodes.comment: I am a doctor and mother of a kindergarten. The single most important protection for our children who are too young to be vaccinated is having everyone wear a mask. I have spent the entire last year and a half diligently protecting my family, and doing my best to protect my community. Now as cases are surging, I have been stripped of the ability to protect my child and my community is suffering.
nodes.author: Carolyn Emerick
nodes.extracted: I have spent the entire last year and a half diligently protecting my family, and doing my best to protect my community.

nodes.comment: I’m signing because I trust my doctors and our family pediatrician. I want my kids in school and not in quarantine.
nodes.author: Kim Stuart
nodes.extracted: I’m signing because I trust my doctors and our family pediatrician.

nodes.comment: My family has several people who are high risk, we are doing our best to only go out when necessary, we wear masks, but that only protects us a little.  Please wear masks to protect our vulnerable community members
nodes.author: Rebecca Lower
nodes.extracted: My family has several people who are high risk, we are doing our best to only go out when necessary, we wear masks, but that only protects us a little.

nodes.comment: My children are to young to get vaccinated, and we want to keep our family safe!
nodes.author: Felisha Yon
nodes.extracted: My children are to young to get vaccinated, and we want to keep our family safe!

nodes.comment: I was recently diagnosed with cancer and went through chemo radiation and surgery I'm currently staying with my daughter and her family she has four boys. Three out of four of her sons have been vaccinated the younger one who has seizures has not and I have been vaccinated but I still and being very careful because I'm still compromised. Do the right thing. Mask in school
nodes.author: emma english`
nodes.extracted: I was recently diagnosed with cancer and went through chemo radiation and surgery I'm currently staying with my daughter and her family she has four boys.

nodes.comment: I want to live. So does my family.
nodes.author: Anisa Masrura
nodes.extracted: So does my family.

nodes.comment: As a Family Nurse Practitioner I can tell you first hand how our west Texan population is suffering not only from Covid but from lack of access to care. The staff I work with risk their lives daily and are overwhelmed. Please, please help by closing anything nonessential. There’s no time and no choice.
nodes.author: Jim Rosson
nodes.extracted: As a Family Nurse Practitioner I can tell you first hand how our west Texan population is suffering not only from Covid but from lack of access to care.

nodes.comment: As Delta becomes more widespread,  we need to work to protect the friends, family,  and community members that cannot be vaccinated and even those that are. The vaccine isn't 100% protection. People can still get sick,  be hospitalized, and die. Wearing a mask is something everyone can do to protect our community.
nodes.author: Melissa Barbieri
nodes.extracted: As Delta becomes more widespread,  we need to work to protect the friends, family,  and community members that cannot be vaccinated and even those that are.

nodes.comment: I am signing not only for the safety of my children and family but also the community. Let’s trust the experts at the  CDC and AAP.
nodes.author: Lidia Araujo
nodes.extracted: I am signing not only for the safety of my children and family but also the community.

nodes.comment: We have two 11 year old children returning to middle school this year which means they will be exposed to a much higher number of other kids and teachers.   I have senior parents that we see regularly that are vaccinated but at extremely high risk.   I have significant fears that our kids could transmit the Delta variant to my family resulting in catastrophe.  Our kids will be masked and cautious but it would be MUCH better if others were as well!!
nodes.author: Johanna Glinsboeckel
nodes.extracted: I have significant fears that our kids could transmit the Delta variant to my family resulting in catastrophe.

nodes.comment: I want my kids and family to be safe.
nodes.author: Tara Kieffer
nodes.extracted: I want my kids and family to be safe.

nodes.comment: I have family members with compromised immune systems.
nodes.author: John Hooper
nodes.extracted: I have family members with compromised immune systems.

nodes.comment: My family lives in Duluth and multiple members have compromised immune systems which puts them at a higher risk.
nodes.author: Rachel Larson
nodes.extracted: My family lives in Duluth and multiple members have compromised immune systems which puts them at a higher risk.

nodes.comment: I care for my family, my friends and my community.
nodes.author: Sarah Reedstrom
nodes.extracted: I care for my family, my friends and my community.

nodes.comment: I’m signing for the safety of my family and friends, why wouldn’t everyone?!
nodes.author: George Kasapidis
nodes.extracted: I’m signing for the safety of my family and friends, why wouldn’t everyone?

nodes.comment: As a vaccinated teacher, I’m now much less at risk than my students.  I taught last year in a mask with a voice amplifier I bought myself.  It still works.  I will teach in a mask again if it mean that fewer of my students will fall ill or experience the trauma of seeing their friends and family members suffer.  This should be a question answered by the interests of public health, not politics.
nodes.author: Lindsay Miller
nodes.extracted: I will teach in a mask again if it mean that fewer of my students will fall ill or experience the trauma of seeing their friends and family members suffer.

nodes.comment: People are not taking this serious. I am seeing more and more without a mask. Sadly, it won't be taken seriously until it affects their family. I do not want to be that person who ends up saying you woulda, coulda, shoulda but didn't.
nodes.author: Kristie Holmes
nodes.extracted: Sadly, it won't be taken seriously until it affects their family.

nodes.comment: I am going in to nineth grade this year and some family have little siblings that can get vaccinated yet. We need to protect them.
nodes.author: Cassie Grottenthaler
nodes.extracted: I am going in to nineth grade this year and some family have little siblings that can get vaccinated yet.

nodes.comment: Signing this because I work in a school and I’ve seen firsthand that even students who survive this end up losing family members to this awful disease.
nodes.author: Cami Sotela
nodes.extracted: Signing this because I work in a school and I’ve seen firsthand that even students who survive this end up losing family members to this awful disease.

nodes.comment: I want my friends and family to stay healthy. In order to do that, EVERYONE needs to stay healthy.
nodes.author: Debbie Burmeister
nodes.extracted: I want my friends and family to stay healthy.

nodes.comment: I'm signing because I care about my community and my family. The teachers deserve as much protection as they will be giving their kids. I also don't trust that everyone will screen their kids and send them to school sick. It happened before this and it will continue to happen.
nodes.author: Erin Martin
nodes.extracted: I'm signing because I care about my community and my family.

nodes.comment: All essential workers are required to wear a mask . Now in York Co. all patrons must wear a mask to enter any business. Teachers are essential workers . Masks can help prevent the spread of illness. Masks can help keep teachers, faculty, students, and other family members safe.
nodes.author: Michelle Gamble
nodes.extracted: Masks can help keep teachers, faculty, students, and other family members safe.

nodes.comment: I signed this because I have friends and family who attend these schools and I care about their health and safety. This whole thing is ridiculous. Why would you not want to help save a life? Even one life? Do your part.
nodes.author: Will Posthumus
nodes.extracted: I signed this because I have friends and family who attend these schools and I care about their health and safety.

nodes.comment: I can’t believe a petition is even necessary!!! You have severely mishandled this pandemic and that won’t soon be forgotten by your voters!! We need help NOW!!!!! The hospitals are out of beds, the nurses and doctors are EXHAUSTED!!! How dare you!! Why don’t you put on some scrubs and jump in there at UMC or Covenant here in Lubbock and work a shift or two?!?! Or come hold an iPad while a family says goodbye to their loved one as they die ALONE!! You have no clue what these frontline workers are dealing with on a daily basis, nor the loneliness these patients  are feeling...you are an absolute disgrace!! PATHETIC!!!!!
nodes.author: Shauna Sandell
nodes.extracted: Or come hold an iPad while a family says goodbye to their loved one as they die ALONE!!

nodes.comment: I want to protect my fellow teachers, my students, and my family. I want to protect my son who works at a grocery store; Texas deserves leadership that follows the CDC recommendations.
nodes.author: Ann Lowrey
nodes.extracted: I want to protect my fellow teachers, my students, and my family.

nodes.comment: Both my kids are going back in person after over a year of virtual learning. For 18 months our family has followed ALL the mitigation measures and I’m so thankful that we have remained healthy. But I’m concerned for my daughter’s safety when she returns to school next week. She’s going to wear a mask but I suspect many others will not. I’m frustrated that this virus is going to keep mutating and each new variant may be even more dangerous and or contagious. Viral mutations can/should result in changes in mitigation measures.  Flexibility and Adaptability are crucial when dealing with viruses. Last year some said “those afraid of the virus should stay home.” Now it’s time for those afraid of safety measures (like wearing masks) to stay home.
nodes.author: Kristie Kent
nodes.extracted: For 18 months our family has followed ALL the mitigation measures and I’m so thankful that we have remained healthy.

nodes.comment: We and our kids and our grandkids all live in Orange County. We want to be with our family and support our local businesses. Masks clearly safe lives and prevent the spread of covid-19. Listen to the majority of your citizens and not just the very vocal & agitating minority
nodes.author: gailyn fitch
nodes.extracted: We want to be with our family and support our local businesses.

nodes.comment: My son starts KG at MES and I want to protect him, my family and the community. Masks work to decrease COVID-19 transmission!!
nodes.author: Sidra Anwar
nodes.extracted: My son starts KG at MES and I want to protect him, my family and the community.

nodes.comment: I’m a health care working my coworkers fall to this virus everyday! Our city is dying and no one is doing anything! This is not about money it’s about lives! Shut our city down! We don’t care about businesses we care about our family! The government needs to assist those out of work! I’ve never been so disappointed in my life with the way Texas has handled covid!
nodes.author: Allison Lopez
nodes.extracted: We don’t care about businesses we care about our family!

nodes.comment: Sending my children back to school is terrifying. Not wearing masks disregards our children’s health, as well as their family’s. It’s not political, it’s science and lives. Do we have to wait until a certain amount of children become critically ill or worse before masks are required?
nodes.author: Marleigh Whiteman
nodes.extracted: Not wearing masks disregards our children’s health, as well as their family’s.

nodes.comment: As a high risk family,  I ask that you reconsider lifting the mandate
nodes.author: vanessa rice
nodes.extracted: As a high risk family,  I ask that you reconsider lifting the mandate

nodes.comment: I don't want my family members to become statists.
nodes.author: Linda Waldenberger
nodes.extracted: I don't want my family members to become statists.

nodes.comment: Y’all mandate a dress code but can’t mandate masks for your faculty and staff. What happens when a child brings COVID into their household and it kills their family members? Will you take accountability? Mandate masks or expect lawsuits..... �
nodes.author: Heather Hall
nodes.extracted: What happens when a child brings COVID into their household and it kills their family members?

nodes.comment: I want my friends and family members the safest they can be since the pandemic is not over.
nodes.author: Treasure Zimmerman
nodes.extracted: I want my friends and family members the safest they can be since the pandemic is not over.

nodes.comment: Maybe it's different when you actually lose family & friends to COVID. When you see the toll it has taken on so many healthcare workers & essential workers. I will wear my mask. We are in this together!
nodes.author: Crystal Lewis
nodes.extracted: Maybe it's different when you actually lose family & friends to COVID.

nodes.comment: My immune compromised daughter is a senior there at A&M. I want her to be able to safely Graduate from the only university she can consider going to in the next year. Please protect your students, your staff and the family members visit your campus especially those who are immune compromised.
nodes.author: Leslie Irick
nodes.extracted: Please protect your students, your staff and the family members visit your campus especially those who are immune compromised.

nodes.comment: Because I want to protect my patients, their family, my family and myself...
nodes.author: Gai Casenas
nodes.extracted: Because I want to protect my patients, their family, my family and myself...

nodes.comment: I have unlined conditions due to my personal health. My health and family comes first.
nodes.author: Jennifer Brown
nodes.extracted: My health and family comes first.

nodes.comment: I work for Walmart I’m scared for my family
nodes.author: Josephine Sylvester
nodes.extracted: I work for Walmart I’m scared for my family

nodes.comment: Wearing masks in public places is only effective if the majority are held accountable to! Make it mandated to ensure the safety of residents. Too many people are weary of the virus and think it has no affect on them. People state "freedoms" and "doing research." These people are not on the frontlines and honestly don't understand what this new virus can do to a person and even a new bidding family. Until it affects them, they will not understand.  Time to protect those who refuse to be protected.
nodes.author: Tiffany Lash
nodes.extracted: These people are not on the frontlines and honestly don't understand what this new virus can do to a person and even a new bidding family.

nodes.comment: My family and friends live in St. Lucie County and it makes sense to do so.
nodes.author: Liz Pitre
nodes.extracted: My family and friends live in St. Lucie County and it makes sense to do so.

nodes.comment:
How many Americans died in WW II?
How many Americans have died from Covid-19?  Would you ever hand a sniper shooting at your family members a gun and more ammunition?  This SARS-CoV2 virus is the sniper and we are in a war.  This war Is not with another country but with a zoonotic virus.  We must protect all children, especially those who are not vaccinated.  Masks used properly (https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/prevent-getting-sick/about-face-coverings.html )work, and are an excellent tool to disable this virus.  Please make this about our kids, grandkids, neighbors and friends.  We should be discussing which masks work best for children, how to supply masks for everyone, how to instill in young students proper mask use (such as why exchanging a used masks with a friend is a bad idea).  Arguing against mask use is helping the enemy (this sniper virus) and it’s friends (those who help it spread??).  Please protect the children and teachers by supporting mask use, getting vaccinated and believing in science and truth.
nodes.author: Stephen Herrmann
nodes.extracted: Would you ever hand a sniper shooting at your family members a gun and more ammunition?

nodes.comment: If wearing a mask means 1 less family loosing a loved one it is worth it.
nodes.author: Sharlene Selvaratnam
nodes.extracted: If wearing a mask means 1 less family loosing a loved one it is worth it.

nodes.comment: I want people to take this diseases seriously. I have had 10 family members infected up north. 3 almost didn't make it. Lives are more important than the economy!!!
nodes.author: Tonya Carrizales
nodes.extracted: I have had 10 family members infected up north.

nodes.comment: Wearing a mask is socially responsible to help safe guard everyone, especially those who are immune compromised or have other at risk family members at home.  I certainly hope the schools take this simple precaution to protect their students and families AND their TEACHERS who may be struggling with the thought of being in a room full of potential asymptomatic carriers.
nodes.author: Kim Lehmann
nodes.extracted: Wearing a mask is socially responsible to help safe guard everyone, especially those who are immune compromised or have other at risk family members at home.

nodes.comment: I don’t want my family sick.  I also have lupus and I’m type 1 diabetic.  Can’t take the chance
nodes.author: Barbara Davis
nodes.extracted: I don’t want my family sick.

nodes.comment: My daughter and several other family members are medical staff as well as teachers and unvaccinated and unmasked means danger for them.
nodes.author: Greg Taylor

nodes.comment: I need safety for my family and others too

nodes.comment: Family practice physician
nodes.author: Lisa Ford
nodes.extracted: Family practice physician

nodes.comment:
Roshni Patel, MD
Family Medicine
Rules are set for safety and to maintain order.  Masks are effective and are not invasive to anyone.  The FAA and TSA have no problems getting mask rules in place, or consumers can forego flying.   These are our children.  Let them safely go to school without fear of spread of this deadly virus.  We do not need to have us end up on the news in order to make a change.  It is simple to understand the effect of a COVID viral spread through a school or community, city, or county.   There is going to be a time for no masks again.  We are not there yet.
nodes.author: Roshni Patel
nodes.extracted:
Roshni Patel, MD
Family Medicine
Rules are set for safety and to maintain order.

nodes.comment: I'm signing in because there's going to be more people that are going to be infected if there's people that are infected if we do not wear the mask we're going to get infected it's going to be like when they said okay we approved that the bars and everything opens so what happened what happened is that a lot of people got infected infected with the covid so I think that it's going to be the same thing if we do not wear the masks even if they win not to put on the mask us that my family and I are still going to be using the masks no matter what thank you and God bless you all

nodes.comment: I am a nurse. Please wear a mask to protect you, your family, and the healcare workers in your local hospitals who are taking care of the sick. Thank you.
nodes.author: Jessica Yoo
nodes.extracted: Please wear a mask to protect you, your family, and the healcare workers in your local hospitals who are taking care of the sick.

nodes.comment: I care about the well being of others. I have immunocompromised family, and while my mask does little to protect me, it does protect others. If everyone wore masks, I'd worry less about going out and taking family out because I know there would be some measure of protection for them.

nodes.extracted: I have immunocompromised family, and while my mask does little to protect me, it does protect others. [...] If everyone wore masks, I'd worry less about going out and taking family out because I know there would be some measure of protection for them.

nodes.comment: For the safety of myself and my family.

nodes.comment: I am a teacher and too many family members are still unvaccinated.

nodes.comment: I have a responsibility to protect myself,  my family and the general population.

They take medication that lowers their immunity and if this people around with no math they can spread it to them and wipe out a whole entire family who has a lot of problems with our immunity. And if it's really the parent's choice or I'm a parent and I choose to put mask on children!!!

nodes.comment: One of my children became infected with covid-19 after spending a week at summer camp where she and her brother were the only children wearing masks. The entire family has since gotten sick. I'm certain it could have been prevented had everyone been required to wear masks.
nodes.author: Karina Hensberry
nodes.extracted: The entire family has since gotten sick.

nodes.comment: We have 6 family members who teach in Pinellas County and grandchildren who attend school there and I would like them to stay safe. It has been proven that masks do not harm children. It has been proven that it does not effect their lung development. It keeps them alive!
nodes.author: Cindy Cruz
nodes.extracted: We have 6 family members who teach in Pinellas County and grandchildren who attend school there and I would like them to stay safe.
